intro: Scheelea cephalotes, commonly known as the crowned palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically found near the base of the plant. Scheelea cephalotes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils.
